title: Frankensteinâ€™s Cat, Rachel and the Beatnik Playboys and Julien Labro
teaser: Dee Perry chats with Emily Anthes author of Frankenstein's Cat: Cuddling Up to Biotech's Brave New Beasts who speaks Friday night at The Cleveland Museum of Natural History for the Explorer Series.  Plus we share the music of local country crooners Rachel & The Beatnik Playboys who play The Stocker Center in Elyria this weekend.  Dee also welcomes back accordion master Julien Labro to the Key Bank studio for a preview of his performance at Severance Hall for The Cleveland Orchestra's Fridays@7 series.
